block.p: Lauren Beth Sobel, a daughter of Barbara and Alex Sobel of Oceanside, N.Y., is to be married this evening to Dr. Marc Brooks Shapiro, a son of Daryl and Edward Shapiro of West Orange, N.J. Rabbi Asher Lopatin will officiate at Windows on the World in New York.

Ms. Sobel, 36, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a partner in Anderson Kill & Olick, a law firm in New York. She graduated cum laude from Union College and received a law degree from George Washington University. Her father is the chairman of the Serge Elevator Company, a manufacturer in Wood-Ridge, N.J. Her mother teaches reading at the Charles Campagne School in Bethpage, N.Y.

Lauren Beth Sobel, a daughter of Barbara and Alex Sobel of Oceanside, N.Y., is to be married this evening to Dr. Marc Brooks Shapiro, a son of Daryl and Edward Shapiro of West Orange, N.J. Rabbi Asher Lopatin will officiate at Windows on the World in New York.

Ms. Sobel, 36, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a partner in Anderson Kill & Olick, a law firm in New York. She graduated cum laude from Union College and received a law degree from George Washington University. Her father is the chairman of the Serge Elevator Company, a manufacturer in Wood-Ridge, N.J. Her mother teaches reading at the Charles Campagne School in Bethpage, N.Y.

Dr. Shapiro, 33, is the Harry and Jeanette Weinberg assistant professor of Judaic studies at the University of Scranton in Pennsylvania. He graduated summa cum laude from Brandeis University and received a Ph.D. in Near Eastern languages and civilizations from Harvard. His father is retired as a history professor at Seton Hall University in South Orange, N.J.
